item.title: Minnesota and DC sue Target-owned Shipt delivery service for worker misclassification
item.description: Minnesota and DC sue Target-owned Shipt delivery service for worker misclassification The Minnesota and District of Columbia attorneys general are suing Target-owned Shipt delivery service over worker misclassification, CBS News has reported.

item.title: Musk-Twitter Countdown to Close $44 Billion Deal Begins
item.description: Musk-Twitter Countdown to Close $44 Billion Deal Begins After months of “will they or won’t they,” Elon Musk is running up against a court-ordered deadline to deliver on his promise to buy Twitter Inc.

item.title: Morgan Stanley Downgrades Meta For First Time As Costs Soar
item.description: Morgan Stanley Downgrades Meta For First Time As Costs Soar Shares of the Facebook parent were down 20% in premarket trading after it gave a disappointing quarterly revenue outlook.

item.title: JSW Steel Expects Margins To Revive After Surprise Loss

item.title: UK Bonds Fall After Government Delays Fiscal Plan To Next Month
item.description: UK Bonds Fall After Government Delays Fiscal Plan To Next Month UK bonds fell as the government delayed its fiscal plan due next week, prolonging uncertainty weighing on the nation’s fragile markets.

item.title: Europe’s Gas Glut to Help Ease Winter LNG Supply Crunch in Asia
item.description: Europe’s Gas Glut to Help Ease Winter LNG Supply Crunch in Asia Europe’s near-term natural gas supply glut means more fuel for Asia this winter.

item.title: Singapore Proposes Ban on Borrowing to Fund Cryptocurrency Purchases
item.description: Singapore Proposes Ban on Borrowing to Fund Cryptocurrency Purchases Singapore proposed to ban retail investors from borrowing to fund cryptocurrency purchases, moving to tighten regulatory regime.

item.title: Bolsonaro Stalls In Polls After Ally Clashes With Police
item.description: Bolsonaro Stalls In Polls After Ally Clashes With Police Leftist challenger Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, 76, would take 54% of valid votes, which exclude null and blank ballots.

item.title: Ye’s Antisemitic Rants Wreck Path To Multibillion-Dollar Fortune
item.description: Ye’s Antisemitic Rants Wreck Path To Multibillion-Dollar Fortune The rapper lost out on a lucrative deal with Adidas, which said it would end the Yeezy line after facing blowback.

item.title: Sunak’s ‘Dullness Dividend’ Might Not Last
item.description: Sunak’s ‘Dullness Dividend’ Might Not Last Britain’s new prime minister is an improvement over his predecessors — but keeping his promises won’t be easy.

item.title: Too Much Gas. Europe’s Energy Crisis Takes A Surprise Turn
item.description: Too Much Gas. Europe’s Energy Crisis Takes A Surprise Turn Europe suddenly has more gas than it can use.

item.title: Rishi Sunak Tells UK Tories To Unite As He Strives To Fix ‘Crisis’
item.description: Rishi Sunak Tells UK Tories To Unite As He Strives To Fix ‘Crisis’ Rishi Sunak called on his warring Conservative Party to unite as the UK’s incoming prime minister bids to fix the crisis facing the economy.

item.title: Sunak Edges Closer to UK Leadership Prize As Johnson Caves
item.description: Sunak Edges Closer to UK Leadership Prize As Johnson Caves Boris Johnson pulled out of the race to lead the UK’s ruling Conservative Party and the nation, ending a bid to replace Liz Truss as prime minister.
